comments.body: Can you please write either in the commit message or here in the PR conversation what the motivation is for this change? Thanks a lot!

I changed the proxy such that you can also instantiate it as
```c++
RooTemplateProxy<const Stuff>
```

Now, the base class, `RooArgProxy` is not a template, and it only ever takes `RooAbsArg*` (non-const!). This cannot change (unless you are willing to go through a lot of pain).
The type and const correctness therefore only comes in through the casts that happen in `RooTemplateProxy`, but in order to hand a `const` reference up to `RooArgProxy`, you have to cast the constness away.

See another way to do it?
I see, so if one uses `RooTemplateProxy` as intended, the cons-correctnes violation is just behind the scenes. Makes sense!
